body_html:
TRPO uses raw probabilities, plus PyTorch is useful for more than just ML, since it has a nice numpy interface over gpu acceleration.

I hardly think that adding the second most intuitive thing you can do with a distribution (besides sampling from it) is interface creep.

body:
TRPO uses raw probabilities, plus PyTorch is useful for more than just ML, since it has a nice numpy interface over gpu acceleration.

I hardly think that adding the second most intuitive thing you can do with a distribution (besides sampling from it) is interface creep.
